Artefact.Name: Summon Bats
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game can summon either a Bat Swarm (one Base) or D3+1 Fell Bats
Artefact.Description: Once per game the Vampire can use this power at the start of one of his turns. He can choose to summon either a Bat Swarm (one Base) or D3+1 Fell Bats. Immediately calculate the Victory points value new unit. The uniy can enter from any table edge in the same way as a unit that had pursued an enemy off the field.

Artefact.Name: Call Winds
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Call Wind instead of movement: all shooting is at -1 lo hit, all flying movement is impossible
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of each of his turns the Vampire can decide not to move in that Movement phase and attempt to call winds. Roll a dice: on a result of 1 nothing happens, on a 2 to 6 the Vampire summons a wild storm that will last until the beginning of his next turn. If he is engaged in close combat, wounded or killed, the storm ends immediately. The storm affects the entire battlefield. All shooting is at -1 lo hit. All flying movement is impossible and flying creatures have to use their gnuind Movement value.

Artefact.Name: Walking Death
Artefact.Description: The presence of one or more von Carstein Vampires with this power in a combat adds +1 io their side's combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Summon Wolves
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game can summon D3 Dire Wolves
Artefact.Description: Once per game, the Vampire can use this power at the start of one of his turns to summon D3 Dire Wolves. Immediately calculate the Victory points value new unit. The uniy can enter from any table edge in the same way as a unit that had pursued an enemy off the field.

Artefact.Name: Aura of Dark Majesty
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Normal range of 12" for his troops to be able to march and use his Leadership is extended to 18"
Artefact.Description: If the Vampire is the army's General, the normal range of 12" for his troops to be able to march and use his Leadership is extended to 18".

Artefact.Name: Wolf Form
Artefact.Description: The Movement of the Vampire is increased to 9 as long as he is moving on foot

Artefact.Name: Red Fury
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Blademaster
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Model in base contact lose one of his Attacks, chosen by the Vampire
Artefact.Description: The Vampire can choose one model in base contact with him at the beginning of the Close Combat phase. The chosen model will lose one of his Attacks, chosen by the Vampire if he has different kinds of attack (for example, from a riding beast, bite attacks, etc).

Artefact.Name: Heart Piercing
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Re-roll missed close combat attacks in the first round of every combat
Artefact.Description: The Vampire can re-roll missed close combat attacks in the first round of every combat.

Artefact.Name: Master Strike
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has the Killing Blow special rule.

Artefact.Name: Strength of Steel
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has +1 Strength the turn he charges.

Artefact.Name: Honour or Death
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Enemy character must take a Leadership test and hide in the rear ranks, refusing to fight the Vampire, if the test is failed
Artefact.Description: At the start of a challenge, the enemy character selected to take on the Vampire must take a Leadership test before any blows are struck (a character Immune to Psychology is also immune to this effect). If the test is failed, the enemy character will change his mind and hide in the rear ranks, refusing to fight the Vampire. Then the combat will proceed as normal, with no challenges fought that turn and the Vampire will be free to fight against any models he is in contact with.

Artefact.Name: Nehekhara's Noble Blood
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has one extra Magic Level. A Thrall with this power is a Level 1 Wizard in all respects and can be the army's General

Artefact.Name: The Awakening
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +D3 to the total number of Skeletons or Zombies created by Invocation of Nehek
Artefact.Description: Whenever the Vampire casts the Necromantic spell Invocation of Nehek he can add +D3 to the total number of Skeletons or Zombies created. For example, if he casts a level 2 Invocation, he can raise 2D6+D3 Skeletons.

Artefact.Name: Dark Acolyte
Artefact.Description: The presence of the Vampire on the battlefield adds one dice to the player's pile of Power dice (no effect on the Dispel dice).

Artefact.Name: Unholy Cynosure
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game, can re-roll one of the dice rolled to cast a spell
Artefact.Description: Once per game, the Vampire can re-roll one of the dice rolled to cast a spell. This can be used to negate a Miscast result or could cause an Irresistible Force result.

Artefact.Name: Master of the Black Arts
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The range of all spells is increased by 6"
Artefact.Description: The range of all spells cast by the Vampire is increased by 6". This power won't affect spells without a range (like Hand of Dust) nor the range or spells cast from bound spell items.

Artefact.Name: Forbidden Lore
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Knows one more spell than he is normally allowed
Artefact.Description: The Vampire knows one more spell than he is normally allowed. This does not increase his Magic Level.

Artefact.Name: Curse of the Revenant
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has the Regeneration special rule.

Artefact.Name: Massive Monstrosity
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has +1 Wound on his profile.

Artefact.Name: Bat Form
Artefact.Description: The model has the Fly special rule.

Artefact.Name: Infinite Hatred
Artefact.Description: The Vampire can re-roll all failed To Hit rolls.

Artefact.Name: Summon Ghouls
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per game can summon D3+1 Ghouls
Artefact.Description: Once per game, the Vampire can use this power at the start of one of his turns to summon D3+1 Ghouls. Immediately calculate the Victory points value of the new unit. The unit can enter from any table edge in the same way as a unit that had pursued an enemy off the field.

Artefact.Name: Iron Sinews
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has +1 Strength on his profile.

Artefact.Name: Seduction
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: One model in base contact with the Vampire must take a Leadership test, if the test is failed, the victim is controlled by the Vampire player in that Close Combat phase
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase select one model in base contact with the Vampire. The selected model must take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the victim is controlled by the Vampire player in that Close Combat phase. The model will direct its attacks against his own side. The model cannot be attacked by either side in that Close Comhat phase but, after combat resolution has been worked out, he reverts immediately to the original player's control and can therefore use his Leadership for any Break tests and can be broken and pursued as normal. If the model has no friendly models in base contact, it will count as being dominated.

Artefact.Name: Domination
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: One model in base contact must take a Leadership test, if the test is failed, the victim cannot attack in that Close Combat phase and all attacks directed against the victim will hit automatically
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase select one model in base contact with the Vampire. The selected model must take a Leadership test. If the test is failed, the victim cannot attack in that Close Combat phase and all attacks directed against the victim will hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Quickblood
Artefact.Description: The Vampire has a Ward save of 5+.

Artefact.Name: Innocence Lost
Artefact.Description: The Vampire always attacks first in close combat, even if charged. If an enemy has the same power because of a magic item or spell, hits are resolved in order of Initiative. If the Vampire and her enemy have the same Initiative, roll a dice to decide who attacks first.

Artefact.Name: Transfix
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase select one model in base contact with the Vampire. The selected model must take a Leadership test. If test is failed, the victim cannot attack in that Close Combat phase.

Artefact.Name: Beguile
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase select one model in base contact with the Vampire. The selected model must take a Leadership test. If test is failed, the victim cannot attack the Vampire in that the Close Combat phase.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strength

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispel

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: Automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: Frostblade
Artefact.Description: Armour saving throws are not allowed against the Frostblade. Ward saves can he taken as nornal. For every unsaved wound caused by this sword, the victim must take a Toughness test to resist magic. If he fails, he is killed outright (remember that a 6 is always a failure). If the victim passes the test then he suffers damage (mm die hlow as normal

Artefact.Name: Blood Drinker
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: For every model killed in close comhat the wearer immediately regenerates one lost Wound
Artefact.Description: For every model killed in close comhat the wearer immediately regenerates one lost Wound. This cannot take the character's Wounds characteristic above its initial value.

Option.Name: Necrarch
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to the total rolled when trying to cast a spell
Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour

Option.Name: Blood Dragon
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Full Plate Armour
Must always issue challenges and must always accept enemy challenges

Option.Name: Strigoi
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour
Cannot use any magic item

Option.Name: Lahmia
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: All models in base contact suffer a -1 to their Leadership
Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour

Option.Name: Necrarch
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to the total rolled when trying to cast a spell
Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour

Option.Name: Blood Dragon
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Full Plate Armour
Must always issue challenges and must always accept enemy challenges

Option.Name: Strigoi
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour
Cannot use any magic item

Option.Name: Lahmia
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: All models in base contact suffer a -1 to their Leadership
Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour

Option.Name: Blood Dragon
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Must always issue challenges and must always accept enemy challenges

Option.Name: Strigoi
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour
Cannot use any magic item

Option.Name: Lahmia
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: All models in base contact suffer a -1 to their Leadership
Cannot choose any mundane weapons or armour

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: BSB

Option.Name: Battle Standard Bearer
Option.SpecialRuleDescription: BSB

Special.SpecialRuleDescription: Flying move is restricted to a maximum of 10"
